intro: Josephia cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf Josephia, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Josephia cuneata is often found in desert and semi-desert regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
